meanings.sent1: Leaves left on the ground too long may molder away.
meanings.sent2: Over time, old books can molder and fall apart.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich began to molder in the lunchbox.
meanings.sent4: Neglected dreams can quietly molder in the corners of the mind.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house started to molder into a heap of rubble.

meanings.sent1: The ancient statue began to molder from the effects of weather.
meanings.sent2: If you leave bread out, it will eventually molder and become inedible.
meanings.sent3: The neglected sandcastle started to molder back into the beach.
meanings.sent4: The once proud castle now moldered into ruins.
meanings.sent5: The old bridge slowly began to molder away, piece by piece.

meanings.sent1: Without proper care, fruits will molder and become mushy.
meanings.sent2: Food left in the fridge too long will molder and develop mold.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten leftovers began to molder in the back of the fridge.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned ship started to molder away in the harbor.
meanings.sent5: The fallen tree began to molder into the forest floor, returning to the earth.
